clinical_study.brief_title: Modeling of Regional Citrate Anticoagulation With a Dialysate Containing Calcium in Intermittent Hemodialysis (MARC)
clinical_study.official_title: Modeling of Regional Citrate Anticoagulation With a Dialysate Containing Calcium in Intermittent Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to validate a mathematical modeling of treatment by intermittent hemodialysis using regional citrate anticoagulation with a dialysate containing calcium

detailed_description.textblock: The only visit to the study will be carried out during a usual dialysis session in the intensive care unit of Clermont-Ferrand University Hospital. In addition to the usual care, 2 blood samples will be taken from the blood circuit 1 hour after the start of the hemodialysis session by the nurse in charge of the patient.

primary_outcome.description: measured at dialyzer inlet, in mmol/L
measured at dialyzer inlet, in mmol/L
measured at dialyzer inlet, in mmol/L

arm_group.description: patient treated with intermittent hemodialysis for chronic renal failure

intervention.description: 2 blood samples will be taken from the blood circuit 1 hour after the start of the hemodialysis session by the nurse in charge of the patient.

study_pop.textblock: patients treated with intermittent hemodialysis for chronic renal failure, at university hospital of Clermont-Ferrand
